posts.title: Quad Copter
posts.text: this is a test#ifndef __ekf_h #define __ekf_h #include "matrix.h" #include "inverse.h" using namespace matrix; template <int M, int N> class ekf { protected: Matrix<float, M, M> P; Matrix<float, M, M> Q; Matrix<float, N, N> R; Matrix<float, M, M> I; Matrix<float, M, M> F; Matrix<float, N, M> H; Matrix<float, M, 1> X; Matrix<float, N, 1> Z; private: Matrix<float, N, 1> Y; Matrix<float, N, N> S; Matrix<float, N, N> S_inv; Matrix<float, M, N> K; public: void set_P(int m, int n, float value) { P(m, n) = value; } void set_Q(int m, int n, float value) { Q(m, n) = value; } void set_R(int m, int n, float value) { R(m, n) = value; } void set_I(int m, int n, float value) { I(m, n) = value; } void set_F(int m, int n, float value) { F(m, n) = value; } void set_H(int m, int n, float value) { H(m, n) = value; } void set_X(int m, int n, float value) { X(m, n) = value; } void set_Z(int m, int n, float value) { Z(m, n) = value; } void get_X(int m, int n) { return X(m, n); } void predict(); void correct(); }; template <int M, int N> void ekf<M, N>::predict() { X = F * X; P = F * P * F.transpose() + Q; } template <int M, int N> void ekf<M, N>::correct() { Y = Z - H * X; S = H * P * H.transpose() + R; // &S_inv = inverse<n>(&S); K = P * H.transpose() * S_inv; X = X + (K * Y); } #endif

posts.title: Hello World
posts.text: Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post1$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server1$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files1$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites1$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment
